name: Whitsunday
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to the Whitsunday, one of the grandest Christian holidays celebrated on the 50th day after Easter
averseDescription: On the coin obverse, there is a depicted a charm garland made of flowers, in the middle of which there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and above it - 2004, the coin issue year. To the left and to the right there are conventionalized rye spikelets, poppy-heads and cornflowers. Beneath the garland there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 10, ГРИВЕНЬ, (Ukraine/ 10/ hryvnia), as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness. There is also the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a group of girls is depicted adorned with flowers, ribbons and garlands, among whom a girl, embellished as a `poplar-tree` is a central figure. At the top and above the group there is a symbolic depiction of the Holy Trinity, on both sides of which there is an inscription: СВЯТО ТРІЙЦІ (Whitsunday Celebration)
